meanings.definition: Having a sensation of spinning or lightheadedness.
meanings.sent1: The carousel made me feel dizzy.
meanings.sent2: She felt dizzy after spinning around too fast.
meanings.sent3: The dizzy feeling from the merry-go-round was both fun and disorienting.
meanings.sent4: His head was a whirlwind of dizzy thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The room spun, leaving her dizzy and disoriented.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel unsteady or confused.
meanings.sent1: The sudden turn in the maze can dizzy you.
meanings.sent2: The magician's trick was meant to dizzy the audience.
meanings.sent3: The complex riddle seemed designed to dizzy the cleverest minds.
meanings.sent4: Her quick movements could dizzy even the most agile opponent.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news seemed to dizzy him momentarily.

meanings.sent1: The thrilling roller coaster ride can dizzy riders.
meanings.sent2: The surprise party plan will surely dizzy her.
meanings.sent3: The dizzying array of choices at the buffet left everyone excited.
meanings.sent4: The sudden success seemed to dizzy him with joy.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the top of the mountain left them all dizzy with excitement.
